subject: Medicine
title: Blood Transfusion History
description: A micro-lesson that makes Blood Transfusion History usable.

hook.text: Early doctors transfused animal blood into humans. Most patients died. Nobody understood why.

buildup.text: In 1901, Karl Landsteiner discovered blood types. Some blood was compatible; some was deadly.

discovery.text: The ABO system explained why transfusions sometimes saved lives and sometimes killed instantly.

twist.text: Blood banking became possible only during World War I, when massive casualties demanded stored supplies.

climax.text: Today, blood transfusions save 4.5 million lives per year in the United States alone.

punchline.text: Knowing your type made sharing blood safe.

quiz.question: What discovery made blood transfusions safe?
options: Karl Landsteiner's identification of blood types
